author: Special Correspondent
text:
Senior police officials of Karaikal, Nagapattinam, and Tiruvarur districts on Wednesday held a meeting to coordinate checks on Puducherry and Tamil Nadu border to curb movement of anti-social and subversive elements.

The officials decided to maintain a close vigil to check movement of cash, arms, and ammunition, explosives, and weapons. The checks on the border would help prevent movement of cash, freebies, and liquor to be distributed among voters during forthcoming elections in Puducherry and Tamil Nadu. The officers agreed to identify and maintain a watch on liquor outlets and anti-social elements residing along the border, a release from Karaikal police said. Officers exchanged phone numbers and email-ids for better co-ordination and co-operation between the two State Police Officers for quick dissemination and sharing of information and intelligence. Details about pending warrants, proclaimed offenders, absconders, and rowdy elements were exchanged.

A.K. Gawas, Senior Superintendent of Police, Karaikal, chaired the meeting. D. Vamseedhara Reddy, Superintendent of Police, Karaikal-South, Gunasekaran, Superintendent of Police, Karaikal – North D. Kannan, Superintendent of Police, Nagapattinam, and other senior officials from Nagapattinam and Tiruvarur districts participated.
title: Puducherry, TN police officials hold meet
